revised_title: Geochemistry and Pollution: Environmental Research on Lead, Cadmium, and Other Hazardous Trace Metals
tldr: This article discusses the environmental geochemistry and health implications of lead, cadmium, and other hazardous trace metals. It presents research findings from various universities in the United States, focusing on the transport, distribution, and potential impacts of these metals on human health and the environment. The article highlights the importance of well-planned sampling programs, good analytical methodology, and understanding the physical and chemical characteristics of these metals to better understand their occurrence, transport, and distribution.
